clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Sphenoid Septation in MRI Compared With CT and Intraoperative Findings During Endoscopic Pituitary Adenoma Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Sphenoid Septation in Magnetic Resonance Imaging Compared With Computed Tomography and Intraoperative Findings During Endoscopic Pituitary Adenoma Surgery - a Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether MRI is able to predict the exact anatomy and topography of the sphenoid sinus and its relationship to the sellar, parasellar und paraclinoid region and where CT yields more detailed information for the surgeon before trans-sphenoidal pituitary adenoma surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
The current research project addresses the question whether MRI alone is sufficient for preoperative planning and computer-assisted surgery (CAS) during standard trans-sphenoidal pituitary surgery and if situations can be identified, where additional CT yields more information for the surgeon.
A comparison of MRI with CT of the skull base or paranasal sinuses and intraoperative Video documentation of the anatomical site will be used.

primary_outcome.measure: Posterior Insertion Site of the sphenoid septum at Cavernous Carotid and/or Optico-Carotid-Recess
primary_outcome.description: To compare the relative performance of the MRI and the CT scan regarding posterior insertion site of the sphenoid septum at cavernous carotid and/or optico-carotid-recess. Neuroimaging results are correlated with intraoperative evaluation during endoscopic transsphenoidal surgery.

intervention.intervention_name: comparison of data from MRI with data from CT compared with intraoperative data from endoscopic pituitary adenoma surgery
intervention.description: A comparison of MRI with CT of the skull base or paranasal sinuses and intraoperative Video documentation of the anatomical site will be used.

study_pop.textblock: Patients within the University hospital of Basel with indicated trans-nasal trans-sphenoidal surgery for pituitary adenoma with preoperative MRI, CT and intraoperative video during endoscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Indicated trans-nasal trans-sphenoidal surgery for pituitary adenoma with preoperative baseline MRI and baseline CT
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous trans-sphenoidal surgery
- Patients without CT, MRI or intraoperative endoscopic video
